```{r}
# Set the seed value for reproducibility
set.seed(145)

# Generate a vector of 10,000 normally distributed numbers with mean 5 and standard deviation 1
data_vector <- rnorm(10000, mean = 5, sd = 1)

# Calculate the mean of the data
mean_value <- mean(data_vector)

# Print the mean value rounded to 4 decimal places
round(mean_value, 4)

```

```{r}
# Load the necessary package for skewness calculation
library(moments)


# Set the seed value for reproducibility
set.seed(100)

sample_means <- replicate(5000, mean(rexp(100, rate = 1/5)))

library(e1071)
skewness_value <- skewness(sample_means)
round(skewness_value, 4)


```


```{r}
library(e1071)
kurtosis_value <- kurtosis(sample_means)
round(kurtosis_value, 4)

```



```{r}
# Load the necessary package for kurtosis calculation
library(moments)

# Set the seed value for reproducibility
set.seed(100)

# Define parameters
lambda <- 1/5          # Rate parameter for the exponential distribution (mean = 5)
sample_size <- 100      # Sample size
num_samples <- 5000     # Number of samples

# Generate 5000 samples of size 100 from the exponential distribution
sample_means <- replicate(num_samples, mean(rexp(sample_size, rate = lambda)))

# Calculate the kurtosis of the sample means
kurtosis_value <- kurtosis(sample_means)

# Print the kurtosis value rounded to 4 decimal places
round(kurtosis_value, 4)

```

```{r}

# Load the data from the file
data <- read.table("preforms.dat", header = TRUE)

# Calculate the mean of the weights
mean_weight <- mean(data$weight)

# Print the result rounded to four decimal places
mean_weight_rounded <- round(mean_weight, 4)
mean_weight_rounded

```

```{r}


# Calculate the mean and standard error
mean_weight <- mean(data$weight)
std_error <- sd(data$weight) / sqrt(length(data$weight))

# Calculate the 95% confidence interval
conf_interval <- mean_weight + c(-1, 1) * qt(0.975, df = length(data$weight) - 1) * std_error

# Extract the lower confidence limit
lower_conf_limit <- round(conf_interval[1], 4)
lower_conf_limit

```

```{r}
# Extract the upper confidence limit
upper_conf_limit <- round(conf_interval[2], 4)
upper_conf_limit
```

```{r}


# Calculate the variance
variance_weight <- var(data$weight)

# Print the result rounded to four decimal places
variance_weight_rounded <- round(variance_weight, 4)
variance_weight_rounded

```

```{r}


# Number of observations
n <- length(data$weight)

# Point estimate for the variance
variance_weight <- var(data$weight)

# Calculate the chi-squared critical values
chi2_lower <- qchisq(0.95, df = n - 1)
chi2_upper <- qchisq(0.05, df = n - 1)

# Calculate the lower and upper confidence limits
lower_conf_limit_variance <- ((n - 1) * variance_weight) / chi2_lower
upper_conf_limit_variance <- ((n - 1) * variance_weight) / chi2_upper

# Round the results to four decimal places
lower_conf_limit_variance_rounded <- round(lower_conf_limit_variance, 4)
upper_conf_limit_variance_rounded <- round(upper_conf_limit_variance, 4)

# Display the results
lower_conf_limit_variance_rounded
upper_conf_limit_variance_rounded

```

```{r}
# Define the sample size and number of nonconforming parts
n <- 500
x <- 15

# Calculate the sample proportion
p_hat <- x / n

# Calculate the standard error
SE <- sqrt(p_hat * (1 - p_hat) / n)

# Calculate the z-score for a 95% confidence level
z <- qnorm(0.975)

# Calculate the lower and upper confidence limits
lower_conf_limit <- p_hat - z * SE
upper_conf_limit <- p_hat + z * SE

# Round the results to four decimal places
lower_conf_limit_rounded <- round(lower_conf_limit, 4)
upper_conf_limit_rounded <- round(upper_conf_limit, 4)

# Display the results
lower_conf_limit_rounded
upper_conf_limit_rounded

```

```{r}
# Given values
n <- 500      # Sample size
x <- 15       # Number of nonconforming parts
p_hat <- x / n  # Sample proportion

# Calculate the 95% confidence interval
alpha <- 0.05
z <- qnorm(1 - alpha/2)  # Z-score for 95% confidence

# Standard error
se <- sqrt(p_hat * (1 - p_hat) / n)

# Confidence interval
lower_limit <- p_hat - z * se
upper_limit <- p_hat + z * se

# Round to 4 decimal places
lower_limit <- round(lower_limit, 4)
upper_limit <- round(upper_limit, 4)

lower_limit
upper_limit

```




```{r}
# Define the sample size and the average number of indications per bar
n <- 250
c_bar <- 2.58

# Calculate the total number of indications
lambda_hat <- n * c_bar

# Calculate the chi-squared critical values
chi2_lower <- qchisq(0.95, df = 2 * n)
chi2_upper <- qchisq(0.05, df = 2 * n)

# Calculate the lower and upper confidence limits for lambda
lower_conf_limit_lambda <- lambda_hat / chi2_lower
upper_conf_limit_lambda <- lambda_hat / chi2_upper

# Round the results to four decimal places
lower_conf_limit_lambda_rounded <- round(lower_conf_limit_lambda, 4)
upper_conf_limit_lambda_rounded <- round(upper_conf_limit_lambda, 4)

# Display the results
lower_conf_limit_lambda_rounded
upper_conf_limit_lambda_rounded

```
